SENT.plain: A 58-year-old man was admitted due to mild right-sided hemiparesis and a speech disturbance
We diagnosed an atherosclerotic brain infarction of the left cerebral hemisphere
The patient had severe clubbing of his fingers and toes bilaterally
Based on the history, clinical features, and X-ray examinations, he was diagnosed as having pachydermoperiostosis
Although general complications have been reported in previous literature, this is the first report of a patient with pachydermoperiostosis who had a cerebrovascular event
